meanings.definition: The office or position of a secretary.
meanings.sent1: In the school, the secretariats are responsible for answering phone calls and organizing paperwork.
meanings.sent2: The secretariats in the company work diligently to ensure all documents are filed correctly.
meanings.sent3: The secretariats had a race to see who could type the fastest, creating a fun competition in the office.
meanings.sent4: The secretariats were the unsung heroes of the office, quietly keeping everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The secretariats sat behind their desks like diligent gatekeepers, ensuring all information flowed through them.

meanings.definition: A group of secretaries or administrative staff.
meanings.sent1: The secretariats gathered for their weekly meeting to discuss upcoming projects.
meanings.sent2: The company hired additional secretariats to help manage the increased workload.
meanings.sent3: During the office party, the secretariats surprised everyone with a flash mob dance routine.
meanings.sent4: The secretariats worked together like a well-oiled machine, efficiently handling all tasks.
meanings.sent5: The secretariats formed a strong bond, supporting each other through busy days and tight deadlines.

meanings.definition: The administrative department of a government or organization.
meanings.sent1: The secretariats of the government met to discuss policy changes and budget allocations.
meanings.sent2: The secretariats of the organization were responsible for coordinating schedules and meetings.
meanings.sent3: The secretariats of the charity hosted a bake sale to raise funds for a local cause.
meanings.sent4: The secretariats of the company were the backbone of operations, ensuring smooth functioning.
meanings.sent5: The secretariats of the school district managed a wide range of tasks, from payroll to event planning.
